content: If there are no entries in Saved Passwords, you would be prompted for one when TB connects to the mail server, such as when TB is restarted. At that point, check the box in the prompt to have the password saved. That is, unless passwords are managed by an external app of the kind that is part of some security suites.
creator: sfhowes

content:
FRom the 'Menu Bar' toolbar: 'View' > 'Message Body As' Offers 3 options - Original html, Simple html and Plain Text

You can use those options to swap the view of email.

But at this moment - what options have you got selected on each computer?

Plain text does not contain formatting because they are plain text. So if the email used a table to format the positioning of content, then in Plain Text mode that 'table' formatting would be removed. But if bullets were used in a html then they should still display in plain text mode.

Currently, I do not know what is contained in the source. Can you offer some info?

Check if email has been sent with both plain text and html. Select email so it displays in Message Pane In the headers area - Click on 'More' and click on 'View Source' It opens in a new window. Look for these lines:

  • Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8"
  • Content-Type: text/html; charset="UTF-8"

If contents only have the text/plain option then email was only sent as plain text. If it has both then email was composed using html, but it's likely you are viewing it in Plain Text mode.

What do you see in the source?

Providing there isn't anything too sensitive - it would be handy to post images of what you see.

Then I'll know what settings you currently use, what info is in view source and the image showing results.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: De tekst in de gele banner "We zullen u nooit vragen een telefoonnummer te bellen, er een sms naar te sturen of persoonlijke gegevens te delen" is een waarschuwing voor scams die voor kunnen komen door het gebruik van een forum, dit heeft niets te maken met het het donatieformulier. Daar is nu eenmaal bepaalde minimale informatie voor nodig: "We begrijpen dat uw privacy zeer belangrijk is. Daarom vragen we om een minimale hoeveelheid aan gegevens die nodig zijn om donaties te verwerken, waaronder factureringsadressen. Om frauduleuze betalingen te voorkomen, gebruiken we adressen in ons interne beoordelingsproces. Uw gegevens worden privé gehouden - als u vragen hebt, wend u dan tot ons [https://www.mozilla.org/privacy/websites/ Privacybeleid]. Als u liever niet uw gegevens op ons online donatieformulier invult, kunt u een cheque of geldwissel toesturen."
creator: Mozilla-assistent

content:
As you are probably aware - the 'Cards View' is new and constantly under development. So it's inevitable that alterations/modifications to code will occur.

The image shows you are currently using the 'Card View' in version 115.15.0

It would be helpful if you could post the content of your 'userChrome.css' file, so I can copy what you are currently using. Then it's possible to replicate your current state.

If you choose to use 128*: 'Tools' > 'Developer Tools' > 'Developer Toolbox' Alllow connection This can be used to identify the areas which you want to tweak. It can be used to help you modify the 'userChrome.css'.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: connessione fuori tempo significa che il server a cui ti colleghi in quel momento è molto lento o è bloccato per cui la connessione dopo un po' "cade". In altri casi può essere la tua connessione ad essere troppo lenta. È comunque qualcosa che dipende dal server o dalla connessione e non direttamente da Thunderbird
